item.title: How do I make karils bow require bolt racks?
item.dc:creator: @Tatemo Tatemo
item.description:
@Tatemo wrote:

[quote=“Bubbsy7, post:18, topic:290569”]I added :

public boolean usingAmmo() { if(playerEquipment[playerArrows] == 4740 && playerEquipment[playerWeapon] == 4734) return true; return false; }

0 errors, but it still doesn’t work…[/quote]

Well of course that doesnt work. You are never asking it to be declared anywhere.

item.title: How do I make karils bow require bolt racks?
item.dc:creator: @Lin Lin
item.description:
@Lin wrote:

[quote="_™, post:15, topic:290569"]public boolean usingAmmo() { if(playerEquipment[playerArrows] == ####) return true; return false; }[/quote]It should be this.

public boolean usingAmmo() { if(playerEquipment[playerArrows] == #### && playerEquipment[playerWeapon] == ####) return true; return false; }Or you can do something like this.

[code]public boolean usingAmmo() {
if(playerEquipment[playerArrows] == ####)
return true;
return false;
}

some method, and then some place inside it
if(playerEquipment[playerWeapon] == ####)
{
if(!usingAmmo())
{
sM(“You don’t have any bolt racks.”);
}
}[/code]You get the point.

Read full topic
